data.title: Garbage and Recycling
data.meta_description: The Town of Whitby provides curbside residential waste collection services to residents, including garbage, green bin organics, yard waste and large items.
data.text:
We provide curbside residential waste collection services to Whitby residents. This includes Garbage, Green bin organics, Yard waste and Special Large Item Collections. Circular Materials manages the Blue box recycling collection and bin replacement services. The Region of Durham provides new and replacement green bins.

Where does it go and when does it get collected?

You can use the Whitby Waste Buddy tool below to view your waste collection schedule, set collection reminders, look up a waste item you are not sure about or schedule a Special Large Item Collection. You can even have some fun playing Whitby's Waste Sorting Game.

You can also use these tools on your mobile device by downloading the Waste Buddy app from Google Play or the App Store.

Waste Collection Calendar Guide 2024/2025

The Town’s Waste Collection Calendar Guide is now paperless.

Residents can download their schedule from the link below or get Whitby’s Waste Buddy App to receive regular collection reminders.

For those that still want a printed copy, a small quantity is available at any Town facility.

Staff safety at the curb

Sharp items like broken glass, knives and razors blades can cause serious injury to collection staff. Help keep your staff safe, and put these sharp items in a cardboard box, tape it closed, label the box with the word “Sharp” and place it beside your regular garbage.

Learn how to safely disposal of needles and syringes (medical sharps).

COVID-19 collection safety Please help protect our waste collection staff by securely bagging all your waste (green bin organics and garbage). Please respect physical distancing and do not approach collection staff closer than two metres. Winter collection safety During the winter, please do not place your garbage, green bins, blue bins or special collections on snowbanks, icy patches, or on the roadway, as this could pose safety concerns to collection staff. On collection day, please place your waste on a cleared space at the end of your driveway. Community waste events View the Region of Durham's special events in Waste Management, including Reuse Days, Compost giveaway events, electronic waste collection events and household hazardous waste collection events. Regional waste management facilities The Region of Durham operates a number of waste management facilities. Visit the Region of Durham to learn more about accepted items, locations, hours of operation, fees, items and more. Litter Cleanups & Adopt , Park, Trail & Road Program Interested in adopting a park, trail or road or simply hosting a cleanup event? We can help! The Town supports individuals and groups who would like to help keep Whitby clean and green. Visit the Whitby's Anti-Litter App to sign-up for for a clean up.

Waste Collection By-law - 7812-21
